components.description: A non-motorized scooter, with two wheels and handles.

description: A non-motorized scooter, with two wheels and handles.
title: Scooter

version.description:
The Unicode Consortium accepted the following emoji 72 emojis for Unicode 9.0. This update was released on June 21, 2016. Most vendors added support for this update within the 2016 calendar year. Sample images and more about Unicode 9.0.

Emoji 4.0 was published in late 2016, which added additional emoji professions.

New in Unicode 9

emoji_net_data.definition: A non-motorized scooter, with two wheels and handles. Kick Scooter was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 under the name ‚ÄúScooter‚Äù and  http://emojipedia.org/scooter/
emoji_net_data.name: kick scooter

bn:00090084v: Drive or propel with the foot
To drive or propel with the foot (e.g. a ball).

bn:02393698n: A kick scooter, push scooter or scooter, is a human-powered land vehicle with a handlebar, deck and wheels that is propelled by a rider pushing off the ground.
A small platform with two or more wheels that is propelled by a rider pushing off the ground, usually just known as a scooter.
A small platform with a handle and two or more wheels that is propelled by a rider pushing off the ground.
A vehicle propelled by a standing rider pushing off the ground
Small platform with a handle and two or more wheels that is propelled by a rider pushing off the ground.

bn:00056048n: A small motorcycle with a step-through frame and a platform for the feet.
A small motorcycle or moped with a step-through frame.
A scooter is a motorcycle with step-through frame and a platform for the operator's feet.
A motorcycle with a step-through frame and a platform for the feet
A motorcycle or moped with a step-through frame
A wheeled vehicle with small wheels and a low-powered gasoline engine geared to the rear wheel
